threeday.summary:
In Somerset, severe river flooding on the Somerset Levels will continue for at least the next three days.
River levels are now gradually falling on the River Thames, however, there are still significant flooding impacts along large stretches of the Thames where the flood risk is MEDIUM.
There is a very low likelihood of significant coastal flooding (LOW flood risk) on Thursday and Friday along parts of the north coast of Devon and Cornwall. This also applies around Chiswell and Preston Beach in Dorset, where beach defences have been degraded. This flood risk could last until Sunday.
In Worcestershire and Gloucestershire (River Severn), river levels are gradually receding with minor impacts continuing for at least the next three days. Minor impacts are also continuing along the lower stretches of the River Dee today (Wednesday). Likewise in Kent, there is now a medium likelihood of minor impacts on the River Stour for at least the next three days, giving a LOW flood risk overall. Impacts include flooding of some properties and agricultural land as well as travel disruption.
There is an ongoing risk from groundwater flooding in Hampshire, Wiltshire, Dorset, Brighton and Hove, Kent and Greater London (Croydon area) for the next three days. Significant impacts are expected such as flooding to properties and roads, and travel disruption. There is also a risk of minor groundwater flooding for much of south-east and south-central England through the next three days.
This forecast is updated at least once daily - please check again for the latest forecast. For local flood information please contact Floodline on 0345 9881188 or 0845 9881188.
threeday.summary_cymru:
Yng Ngwlad yr Haf, mi fydd y llifogydd afon difrifol ar Wastadeddau Gwlad yr Haf yn parhau am o leiaf y tri diwrnod nesaf.
Mae lefelau afonydd yn disgyn yn araf ar yr Afon Tafwys yn awr, peth bynnag, mae effeithiau llifogydd sylweddol dal i fod ar hyd rhannau helaeth o'r Afon Tafwys, lle mae risg CANOLIG o lifogydd.
Mae tebygolrwydd isel iawn o lifogydd arfordirol sylweddol (risg ISEL o lifogydd) ar ddydd Iau a dydd Gwener, ar hyd rhannau o arfordir gogleddol Dyfnaint a Chernyw. Mae hyn hefyd yn berthnasol o amgylch Chiswell a Thraeth Preston yn Dorset lle mae amddiffynfeydd traeth wedi cael eu diraddio. Gall y risg yma o lifogydd parahau tan ddydd Sul.
Yn Swydd Gaerwrangon a Swydd Gaerloyw (Afon Hafren) mae lefelau afonydd yn cilio yn raddol gyda ychydig o effeithiau parhaus ar gyfer o leiaf y tri diwrnod nesaf. Mi fydd ychydig o effeithiau llifogydd hefyd yn parhau ar hyd rhannau isaf yr Afon Dee heddiw (dydd Mercher ). Yn yr un modd yng Nghaint, yn bellach mae yna debygolrwydd canolig o ychydig o effeithiau ar yr Afon Stour am o leiaf y tri diwrnod nesaf, gan roi risg ISEL o lifogydd yn gyffredinol. Gall effeithiau cynnwys llifogydd i rhai o'r tai a thir amaethyddol, yn ogystal â chreu anhawster wrth deithio.
Mae risg parhaus o lifogydd dwr daear yn Hampshire, Wiltshire, Dorset, Brighton, Hove, Caint a Llundain Fwyaf (ardal Croydon) am y tri diwrnod nesaf. Disgwylir effeithiau sylweddol fel llifogydd i dai a ffyrdd, a hynny'n creu anhawster wrth deithio. Mae yna hefyd risg o ychydig o lifogydd dwr daear ar gyfer llawer o dde-ddwyrain a de-ganolog Lloegr drwy'r tri diwrnod nesaf.
Mae'r rhagolwg hwn yn cael ei diweddaru o leiaf unwaith y dydd - edrychwch eto ar gyfer y rhagolygon diweddaraf.
Ar gyfer gwybodaeth llifogydd lleol, cysylltwch â Floodline ar 0345 9881188 neu 0845 9881188.

risk.impact: Severe disruption. Widespread flooding of property. Severe disruption to travel. Loss of gas, electricity, water supplies. Significant disruption to communities. Evacuation expected.
risk.advice: Significant risk to life. Take action to protect yourself and follow the advice of the emergency services.

risk.impact: Significant disruption. Flooding of homes, businesses and transport links - disruption to travel. Disruption to gas, electricity, water supplies and telecoms. Evacuation may be required.
risk.advice: Flooding of property is expected. Take action to protect yourself and your property.

risk.impact: Minor disruption. Flooding of fields, recreational land and car parks. Flooding of a small number of homes and businesses. Wet road services and possibility of ponding water. Local disruption to travel - longer journey times.
risk.advice: Flooding of property is possible - be prepared. Stay vigilant. Water on roads - take care when driving.

risk.impact: Minimal disruption. Flooding of fields, recreational land and car parks. Some local disruption to travel. Wet road services and possibility of ponding water.
risk.advice: Flooding is possible - be prepared. Stay vigilant. Water on roads - take care when driving.
